transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: It's Space Ghost Coast to Coast! Tonight, a word-for-word re-enactment of some old stuff performed by some people you don't know, like Andy Merrill, Dave Willis, and Gus Jordan. Plus, Sean Gooden, Isabel Gonzalez, Scott Lipe, and Rex Bullion. And now, in case you haven't already changed the channel, James Kirkconnell!

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: Welcome to the amazing tales of the classic superhero, Space Ghost, who has entertained young and old for generations. I'm James Kirkconnell, and I'll be your host. Tonight our tales from the Ghost Planet will be re-enacted by the Ghost Planet Dinner Theatre Ensemble, of Doraville, Georgia. Presented for you, the viewer, are a selection of famous moments, from Space Ghost's talk show, "Space Ghost Coast to Coast." Let's look in as our players interpret a scene from the show's fifth episode, entitled "Bobcat," starring funnyman Bobcat Goldthwait. In the following amazing exchange, it is easy to see why Mr. Goldthwait is remembered as one of Space Ghost's favorite guests. And now, our word-for-word re-enactment, of a conversation that took place at a certain time, in a certain dimension, somewhere deep in space. (eerie sound effect)

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Barney's going to make more kids snap than Bugs Bunny.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: A kid knows Bugs Bunny's joking around, kids think Barney's for real!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: "I love you", you don't love us, Barney, you don't even know us!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay! We're back with Bobcat Goldthwait! I understand that you have special powers.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Yes. I'm able to, uh, bend forks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wow!

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: But only at Denny's. Any other kind of forks I don't seem to be able to bend.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wow, now, is this physically or mentally?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Um, I do it with my mind... but you gotta look away, really, for a little while.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: When I said you were pretty, I meant you remind me of Judy Collins.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Judy Collins? (laughs) Wow, Space Ghost, man, crack a window, will ya?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'd be violently sucked into space.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Then maybe people would tune in.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Well, I think Moltar's giving us the signal to wrap it up, huh, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, Bobcat, that's just his way of telling us to finish the interview. Join us for dinner after the show?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Thanks, I'd love to join you for dinner, but I don't know about eating with no gigantic locust. Don't they spit on their food first and then mulch it up and spit it back out?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's regurgitational ingestion, flies do it, not locusts.

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, but you know, that's exactly how I eat, so, perhaps I will dine with you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty! We'll meet you in the chamber after the show. Any parting words?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, I want to party with you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You mean with a party cake and lemonade and paper hats?

transcript.speaker: Bobcat Goldthwait
transcript.dialogue: Perhaps, perhaps.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty then! (taps his cue cards)

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: (claps) And so our classic superhero Space Ghost went on to talk with The Ramones, with typically illuminating results. Next, our actors take on a particularly challenging moment, in the lexicon of Space Ghost's material. Our superhero, stalwart, manly, single, becomes smitten with his guest television superstar turned author, Fran Drescher. We join our troupe just as the blush of love begins to color Space Ghost's superheroic perception for the first time. Once again, I invite you to witness our word-for-word re-enactment, of an amazing scene from the episode "Girlie Show". It took place at a certain time, in a certain dimension, somewhere deep in space. (eerie sound effect)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey hey, ho ho, Space Ghost has got to go. (sign says "DESTROY ALL TALK SHOWS") (repeats chant in background while others talk)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) After lunch, we'll marry, in a simple ceremony. She'll grow to love the Ghost Planet after a while...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (still chanting in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Fran) Don't mind him, dearest. Labor dispute.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Well, you can fire him, you're the star.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey hey, ... He can't fire me! I'm the hardest working mantis in show business! Hi-yo!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Forget him, my fair Nanny! He's but a lowly proletariat.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Actually, I'm Episcopalian.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (lounge music in background) You know, I've never met a woman guest quite like you before, Nanny.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, I know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, I can sense quality in a female of the species when I scan for it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (belches)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak! There's a Nanny present! Watch your mouth!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I can't. It's... it's too underneathy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) My husband says that...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Husband?

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry Nanny, but... good-bye.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (looking puzzled)

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: (claps) One wonders if valiant super-crusader Space Ghost is still haunted, by the melodious laughter of television's "The Nanny". We hope you enjoyed our word-for-word interpretation of their meeting. Next, Space Ghost comes face to face with the disturbing antics of Bill Manspeaker, of the schlock rock group "Green Jelly". We take you now to the re-enactment of a scene from the episode "Freak Show", in which Mr. Manspeaker appears before Space Ghost, in a fearsome and elaborate costume. Our hero expresses his frustration, at Moltar's apparent inability to produce a guest who is not, as Space Ghost says, "a freak." And now, our word-for-word re-enactment, of an amazing conversation, that took place at a certain time, in a certain dimension, somewhere deep in space. (eerie sound effect)

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Hello there, Mr. Space Ghost, where are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And just who are you supposed to be?

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: I'm 100% stupid.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Moltar, do you have any non-freaks to put in my monitor?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well... no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, well that's just great!

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Whe- where's Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, shut up!

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: I, I want Space Ghost now! Where is he?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Are, are you like Jeannie or Bewitched?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: First we start it off with a little guitar (plays air guitar chord) And then I go, "Yeaaaaaah!" And then the girls go, "Woooooo!" And then I go, "Hot mamas!" And then they go, "Here's a whole bunch o' money!" I take the money; then I go out and I try to buy Apple Jacks, but you know, then the secret service is comin', and got hittin' me, and I'd say, "Stop hittin' me, who's hittin' you, stop it!"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: You look like a woman on TV.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, that's it. I can't take this anymore.

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, no, don't leave me!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (zaps the monitor with his destructo ray) Anybody have any idea who that was?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Some lost soul, cowering behind some cheap costume, afraid to reveal his true identity.

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: (claps) And so we conclude this amazing re-enactment of a scene from the classic superhero Space Ghost and his show, "Space Ghost Coast to Coast". This is James Kirkconnell saying, we'll be back in a minute with more re-enactments.

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: Welcome back to our presentation of famous scenes from "Space Ghost Coast to Coast", interpreted by the Ghost Planet Dinner Theatre Ensemble, of Doraville, Georgia. I'm James Kirkconnell, your host. On March 31st, 1995, superhero Space Ghost welcomed as his guest Michael Stipe, from the acclaimed and popular rock combo, "R.E.M." In this re-enactment of a scene from the episode entitled "Hungry", Space Ghost and his band leader Zorak are joined by Raymond, Zorak's small nephew. And now, relax and enjoy our word-for-word re-enactment, of an amazing conversation that took place at a certain time, in a certain dimension, somewhere deep in space. (eerie sound effect)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Mike, I'm going to send you a high-pitched message that only you can hear!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) Why me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (opens mouth, extremely high pitch sound)

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: (tilts head to one side) No message, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay then, sing that song, sing that, "Shiny Shiny People" song.

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll get you started. (sings) "Shiny shiny people, shiny shiny people..."

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: I hate that song, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, me too, Michael, me too. Say, Mike, do think I'm a shiny shiny person?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: I would say yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're sure?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: Yes, absolutely.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't see some dark, horrible corner inside of me somewhere?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: No, none.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. You're sure?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: Yep.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I have a question. Is that you in the corner?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: (looks down under glasses)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (points) That way, in the corner! (picture of Zorak's band, with Michael Stipe's face in lower right corner of screen, rubbing front teeth)

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that's me in the corner, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Freaky!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So what's next for you? What's on your plate? (stomach growls) Oooh!

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I'm, I'm going to drive to dinner.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Take us!

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: I wanna go!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Take us, please!

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: C'mon, Stipe! Give us a break! Buy us some dinner!

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: I wanna sit down.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, how about him, will he take us?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: (in the corner) Yes, absolutely!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Great! See you! (zaps Michael off screen of main monitor)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (to Michael in control room) Just me, Moltar, outta lines, hangin' out.

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: (claps) Space Ghost, Zorak, and his nephew Raymond, never made the proposed dinner with Mr. Stipe, as Raymond was tragically devoured by Zorak, as an off-camera snack. Those hungry for high drama will relish our final re-enactment, a legendary scene from the episode entitled "Banjo", in which Space Ghost nurtures a small sea monkey into a horrific aberration intent on destroying his talk show set. Joining Space Ghost is comic performer Weird Al Yankovic. And now behold our final word-for-word re-enactment of the evening, which begins with an amazing conversation: one that took place at a certain time, in a certain dimension, somewhere deep in space. (eerie sound effect)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak's wacky. Ain't he?

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: Uh, sure, um. Hey, Zorak, you evil locust!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Mantis!

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: My powers are beyond your comprehension.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (eyes spinning) Do a B flat.

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: Baaaaaaaaa! (does a really high B flat).

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (joins in, slightly off key, trying several times) Baaaaaaaaaaaa! Aaaaaaaaaa! Aaaaaaaaaaa!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Now, contort your body.

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: Okay. (contorts his body.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Baaaaaaaa.. what does that feel like?

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's kinda painful and it kinda feels good at the same time.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You mean like when your enemy is shaving your back and...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (shivering) Oh-h-h-h-h-h!

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: (still contorted) Can you help me here, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: Can you help me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah, yeah. (says "spell"; Al un-contorts) You know, that reminds me of a story... a story about a little pellet who, with a little grit and a lot of sheer will, became a Sea Monkey...

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: He also shot a man in Reno just to watch him die.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) And you know, Al, that little Sea Monkey is named... Banjo.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Here, Banjo! (Banjo appears on the set, looking like a Chinese New Year dragon)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Banjo!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Here, shrimp.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aren't you plucky! Finding your way to the set...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh oh. (gets blasted)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jumpin' jujubes!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Man, that's a big shrimp!

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: Well, I gotta go now! (waves, ducks out of his chair and leaves)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, Banjo! Why are you doing this? I gave you life!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No!! (gets blasted again by Banjo)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What have I unleashed! (in a low voice) That's it boy. Come get some.

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: At this moment in the episode entitled "Banjo", explosions rock the set, causing our brave host to plummet from the sky, falling on his superheroic behind. We pick up the episode in time for Space Ghost's closing soliloquy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why do we always hurt the ones we love? Why, Banjo? Why?! Banjo! Banjo! Banjooooo!

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: (claps) And so we have a very grieve Space Ghost, to the end of Banjo, not to mention a lesson learned about the danger of sea monkey kits in space. We hope you have enjoyed our re-enactments, assisted by the Ghost Planet Dinner Theatre Ensemble, of Doraville, Georgia.

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: (claps) Tonight, you have witnessed re-enactments of fantastic adventures, both amazing and profound. This is James Kirkconnell for Space Ghost Coast to Coast, in a certain time, in a certain dimension, bidding you farewell.

transcript.speaker: Bill Manspeaker
transcript.dialogue: Stop hittin' me, who's hittin' you, stop it!

transcript.speaker: James Kirkconnell
transcript.dialogue: (a single clap)
